argument.description: Optional. The number of decimal places to truncate to. This value must be an integer. If this parameter is omitted, the TRUNC function will truncate the number to 0 decimal places.

returnType: The TRUNC function (as it applies to numbers) returns a numeric value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL TRUNC function returns a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places.
sample:
TRUNC(125.815)
Result: 125

TRUNC(125.815, 0)
Result: 125

TRUNC(125.815, 1)
Result: 125.8

TRUNC(125.815, 2)
Result: 125.81

TRUNC(125.815, 3)
Result: 125.815

TRUNC(-125.815, 2)
Result: -125.81

TRUNC(125.815, -1)
Result: 120

TRUNC(125.815, -2)
Result: 100

TRUNC(125.815, -3)
Result: 0
